org.spongepowered.api.world.storage

Interface WorldProperties

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataSerializable

    public interface WorldProperties
extends DataSerializable
    Represents the properties of a World which are persisted across runtime instances.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean areCommandsAllowed()
      Gets whether commands are allowed within this world.
      boolean doesGenerateBonusChest()
      Gets whether the bonus chest should be generated.
      boolean doesGenerateSpawnOnLoad()
      Gets whether spawn chunks of this world will generate on load.
      boolean doesKeepSpawnLoaded()
      Gets whether spawn chunks of this world remain loaded when no players are present.
      DataContainer getAdditionalProperties()
      Gets a DataContainer containing any additional properties for this world.
      Difficulty getDifficulty()
      Gets the difficulty of this world.
      DimensionType getDimensionType()
      Gets the DimensionType of this world.

      Gets the default GameMode of this world.

      Gets the specified GameRule value.

      Gets a map of the currently set game rules and their values.

      Gets an immutable collection of the world generator modifiers currently in use.

      Gets the generator settings.

      Gets the GeneratorType of this world.

      Gets the PortalAgentType for the world.

      Gets a section of the additional properties returned by getAdditionalProperties().

      Gets the diameter the world border is expanding or contracting to.

      Gets the time remaining until the world border stops expanding or contracting.

      Gets the distance when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border is distance blocks away.

      Gets the time when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border will reach in time seconds.

      Gets whether PVP combat is enabled in this world.

        Returns:
        The unique Id

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Gets whether this world is enabled. A world which is enabled but unloaded may be loaded automatically if an attempt is made to transfer an entity to the world using Entity.transferToWorld(org.spongepowered.api.world.World) .
        Returns:
        Is enabled

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean state)
        Sets this world as enabled. A world which is enabled but unloaded may be loaded automatically if an attempt is made to transfer an entity to the world using Entity.transferToWorld(org.spongepowered.api.world.World) .
        Parameters:
        state - The new state

      • loadOnStartup

        boolean loadOnStartup()
        Gets whether this world will load when the server starts up.
        Returns:
        Loads on startup

      • setLoadOnStartup

        void setLoadOnStartup(boolean state)
        Sets whether this world should load when the server starts up.
        Parameters:
        state - Should load on startup

      • doesKeepSpawnLoaded

        boolean doesKeepSpawnLoaded()
        Gets whether spawn chunks of this world remain loaded when no players are present.
        Returns:
        True if spawn chunks of this world remain loaded without players, false if not

        Sets whether the spawn chunks of the world should remain loaded when no players are present.
        Parameters:

      • setSeed

        void setSeed(long seed)
        Sets the seed of this world.

        Warning: this may cause the edge of currently generated chunks to no longer align with newly generated chunks.

        Parameters:
        seed - The new world seed

      • getTotalTime

        long getTotalTime()
        Gets the number of ticks which have occurred since the world was created.
        Returns:
        The total time in ticks

      • getWorldTime

        long getWorldTime()
        Gets the time of day, in ticks. The total number of ticks in a day is 24000, however this value does not reset to zero at the start of each day but rather keeps counting passed 24000.
        Returns:
        The time of day

      • setWorldTime

        void setWorldTime(long time)
        Sets the time of day, in ticks. The total number of ticks in a day is 24000, however this value does not reset to zero at the start of each day but rather keeps counting passed 24000.
        Parameters:
        time - The time of day

        Gets whether commands are allowed within this world. May not be respected when not in single player.

        Sets the difficulty of this world.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - The difficulty

      • doesGenerateBonusChest

        boolean doesGenerateBonusChest()
        Gets whether the bonus chest should be generated.

        This only applies on the initial load of the World created via this properties.

        Returns:
        True if bonus chest is generated, false if not

      • getWorldBorderCenter

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3d getWorldBorderCenter()
        Gets the center of the world border.

        The returned position is three-dimensional. As the world border extends over the entire y-axis, the returned position will always have a y set to 0.

        Returns:
        The center

      • setWorldBorderCenter

        void setWorldBorderCenter(double x,
                          double z)
        Sets the center of the world border.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-axis center of the world border
        z - The z-axis center of the world border

      • getWorldBorderDiameter

        double getWorldBorderDiameter()
        Gets the diameter of the world border.

        The returned diameter applies to the x and z axis. The world border extends over the entire y-axis.

        Returns:
        The diameter

      • setWorldBorderDiameter

        void setWorldBorderDiameter(double diameter)
        Sets the diameter of the world border.

        The specified diameter applies to the x and z axis. The world border extends over the entire y-axis.

        Parameters:
        diameter - The diameter

      • getWorldBorderTimeRemaining

        long getWorldBorderTimeRemaining()
        Gets the time remaining until the world border stops expanding or contracting.
        Returns:
        The time remaining, in milliseconds

      • setWorldBorderTimeRemaining

        void setWorldBorderTimeRemaining(long time)
        Sets the time remaining until the world border stops expanding or contracting.
        Parameters:
        time - The new remaining time

      • getWorldBorderTargetDiameter

        double getWorldBorderTargetDiameter()
        Gets the diameter the world border is expanding or contracting to.

        This will return the same value as getWorldBorderDiameter() unless getWorldBorderTimeRemaining() is greater than 0.

        Returns:
        The diameter being changed to

      • setWorldBorderTargetDiameter

        void setWorldBorderTargetDiameter(double diameter)
        Sets the target diameter of the world border.

        The world border diameter increases/decrease linearly over time specified in getWorldBorderTimeRemaining(). The specified diameter applies to the x and z axis. The world border extends over the entire y-axis.

        Parameters:
        diameter - The diameter where the border will expand/contract to

      • getWorldBorderDamageThreshold

        double getWorldBorderDamageThreshold()
        Gets the distance a player may be outside the world border before taking damage.
        Returns:
        The distance

      • setWorldBorderDamageThreshold

        void setWorldBorderDamageThreshold(double distance)
        Sets the distance a player may be be outside the world border before taking damage.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance

      • getWorldBorderDamageAmount

        double getWorldBorderDamageAmount()
        Gets the damage done to a player per block per tick when outside the buffer.
        Returns:
        The damage amount

      • setWorldBorderDamageAmount

        void setWorldBorderDamageAmount(double damage)
        Sets the damage done to a player per block per tick when outside the buffer.
        Parameters:
        damage - The damage amount

      • getWorldBorderWarningTime

        int getWorldBorderWarningTime()
        Gets the time when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border will reach in time seconds.

        In Minecraft, the warning is displayed in the form of a reddish tint.

        Returns:
        The time, in seconds

      • setWorldBorderWarningTime

        void setWorldBorderWarningTime(int time)
        Sets the time when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border will reach in time seconds.

        In Minecraft, the warning is displayed in the form of a reddish tint.

        Parameters:
        time - The time, in seconds

      • getWorldBorderWarningDistance

        int getWorldBorderWarningDistance()
        Gets the distance when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border is distance blocks away.

        In Minecraft, the warning is displayed in the form of a reddish tint.

        Returns:
        The distance, in blocks

      • setWorldBorderWarningDistance

        void setWorldBorderWarningDistance(int distance)
        Sets the distance when a contracting world border will warn a player for whom the world border is distance blocks away.

        In Minecraft, the warning is displayed in the form of a reddish tint.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance, in blocks

      • getGameRule

        Optional<String> getGameRule(String gameRule)
        Gets the specified GameRule value.
        Parameters:
        gameRule - The name of the GameRule.
        Returns:
        The GameRule value, if it exists.

      • getGameRules

        Map<String,String> getGameRules()
        Gets a map of the currently set game rules and their values.
        Returns:
        An immutable map of the game rules

      • setGameRule

        void setGameRule(String gameRule,
                 String value)
        Sets the specified GameRule value. If one with this name does not exist, it will be created.
        Parameters:
        gameRule - The name of the GameRule.
        value - The value to set the GameRule to.

      • removeGameRule

        boolean removeGameRule(String gameRule)
        Removes custom GameRule.
        Parameters:
        gameRule - The name of the GameRule.
        Returns:
        True if GameRule was deleted, false if not

      • getAdditionalProperties

        DataContainer getAdditionalProperties()
        Gets a DataContainer containing any additional properties for this world. The returned data is a snapshot of the data and is not live.
        Returns:
        Any additional properties

      • getPropertySection

        Optional<DataView> getPropertySection(DataQuery path)
        Gets a section of the additional properties returned by getAdditionalProperties(). The returned data is a snapshot of the data and is not live.
        Parameters:
        path - The path for the section.
        Returns:
        The data view representing the requested section

      • setPropertySection

        void setPropertySection(DataQuery path,
                        DataView data)
        Sets a path within the additional data to the given DataView. If you are using this to store data related to your mod/plugin is is HIGHLY recommended that the identifier you pass in be your mod/plugin id.
        Parameters:
        path - The path for the section
        data - The new data

      • getGeneratorModifiers

        Collection<WorldGeneratorModifier> getGeneratorModifiers()
        Gets an immutable collection of the world generator modifiers currently in use.
        Returns:
        The world generator modifiers in use.

      • setGeneratorModifiers

        void setGeneratorModifiers(Collection<WorldGeneratorModifier> modifiers)
        Sets the given world generator modifiers to be used.
        Parameters:
        modifiers - The modifiers to set.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the modifiers has not been registered in the GameRegistry.

      • getGeneratorSettings

        DataContainer getGeneratorSettings()
        Gets the generator settings. These can be used by the generator type and/or by the generator modifiers.
        Returns:
        The generator settings.

      • getSerializationBehavior

        SerializationBehavior getSerializationBehavior()
        Gets the SerializationBehavior in use.
        Returns:
        The serialization behavior

      • setSerializationBehavior

        void setSerializationBehavior(SerializationBehavior behavior)
        Sets the SerializationBehavior for use.
        Parameters:
        behavior - The serialization behavior
